awd_titl_txt: Dynamical Properties of Strongly Coupled Plasmas (Physics)
awd_abstract_narration: A theoretical study will be performed of dynamical processes               in strongly coupled plasmas using a charged impurity as a probe.                The plasma is characterized through its total electric field at                 the impurity, rather than through particle trajectories and                     cross-sections.  The formulation is more appropriate for strong                 coupling and focuses on electric field dynamics beyond linear                   responses.  The first part of the research involves a study of                  radiative and transport properties of a highly charged ion in a                 one component plasma, developing descriptions of electric field                 dynamics with applications to line shapes as a diagnostic.  The                 second part of the research involves a study of electron                        diffusion, intended to provide understanding of a recently                      discovered localization-delocalization transition.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
